intro: Larnax toledoana, commonly known as the Toledo larnax, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Toledo, Spain. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Due to habitat loss, Larnax toledoana is considered vulnerable and is protected in several conservation programs.
